channel.title: math.KT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.KT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Isomorphism and stable isomorphism in "real" and "quaternionic" K-theory
item.description: arXiv:2501.15993v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We find lower bounds on the rank of a "real" vector bundle over an involutive space, such that "real" vector bundles of higher rank have a trivial summand and such that a stable isomorphism for such bundles implies ordinary isomorphism. We prove similar lower bounds also for "quaternionic" bundles. These estimates have consequences for the classification of topological insulators with time-reversal symmetry.
item.dc:creator: Malkhaz Bakuradze, Ralf Meyer

item.title: Duplicial functors, descent categories and generalized Hopf modules
item.description: arXiv:2501.14561v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: B\"ohm and \c{S}tefan have expressed cyclic homology as an invariant that assigns homology groups $\mathrm{HC}^\chi_i(\mathrm N, \mathrm M)$ to right and left coalgebras $\mathrm N$ respectively $\mathrm M$ over a distributive law $\chi$ between two comonads. For the key example associated to a bialgebra $H$, right $\chi$-coalgebras have a description in terms of modules and comodules over $H$. The present article formulates conditions under which such a description is simultaneously possible for the left $\chi$-coalgebras. In the above example, this is the case when the bialgebra $H$ is a Hopf algebra with bijective antipode. We also discuss how the generalized Hopf module theorem by Mesablishvili and Wisbauer features both in theory and examples.
item.dc:creator: Ivan Bartulovi\'c, John Boiquaye, Ulrich Kr\"ahmer

item.title: Homological duality and exact sequences of Hopf algebras
item.description: arXiv:2501.14800v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We study the stability of homological duality properties of Hopf algebras under extensions.
item.dc:creator: Julian Le Clainche

item.title: Unstable motivic and real-\'etale homotopy theory
item.description: arXiv:2501.15651v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We prove that for any base scheme $S$, real \'etale motivic (unstable) homotopy theory over $S$ coincides with unstable semialgebraic topology over $S$ (that is, sheaves of spaces on the real spectrum of $S$). Moreover we show that for pointed connected motivic spaces over $S$, the real \'etale motivic localization is given by smashing with the telescope of the map $\rho: S^0 \to {\mathbb G}_m$.
item.dc:creator: Aravind Asok, Tom Bachmann, Elden Elmanto, Michael J. Hopkins

item.title: On the Mac Lane $Q$-Construction for Exact $\infty$-Categories
item.description: arXiv:2501.16259v2 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We extend McCarthy's stabilization construction to exact $\infty$-categories. This is achieved by constructing, for any functor from exact $\infty$-categories to a fixed stable $\infty$-category $\mathcal{A}$, a coherent chain complex in $\mathcal{A}$ that is an immediate generalization of Mac Lane's cubical $Q$-complex computing the stable homology of abelian groups.
item.dc:creator: Ettore Aldrovandi, Arash Karimi

item.title: Derived categories of bifiltered complexes
item.description: arXiv:2410.13534v5 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We construct a fundamental theory of the derived category of non-finite bi-filtered complexes.
item.dc:creator: Yukiyoshi Nakkajima
